content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

module TextWrap
    @type text = String
    @type width = Int
    function wrap_string(text: String, width: Int) where (width>0 && isinstance(Text::String))
        if length(text) <= width
            return text
        else
            for i in 1:length(text) step width do
                if (i>1 && length(Text::String(text[0..i-1]))+2 > text_width)
                    return Text::String('\n' + text[i-length(Text::String(text[0..i-1]))+2])
                end
            end
        end
    end

    example:
    println(wrap_string("This is an example", 10))
    println(wrap_string("Here are some long words that should fit nicely on one line and then continue to the next line.", 20))
